title: Golden Gate National Recreation Area: Planning
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Planning             Planning       The Division of Planning is responsible for preparing, updating and implementing park planning and projects. Park planners specialize in project management and design, review other agency projects and neighboring development plans, and manage compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) and other laws and regulations. Planning staff are also responsible for preparing environmental documents such as categorical exclusions, environmental assessments (EA), and environmental impact statements (EIS).  This site is dedicated to providing the public with more information on planning activities and projects within Golden Gate National Recreation Area (GGNRA) and how to stay involved in the planning process. Below are a variety of ways to be involved:   Visit our Current Plans and Projects and Completed Plans and Projects links to learn about park projects.     Sign up to receive e-mail notifications regarding plans, projects, and public meetings.     Attend a Public Meeting or Open House event to speak with NPS and Parks Conservancy staff about current park projects or to participate in a site walk. These events will be posted on individual project websites and announced by e-mail notification.     Visit the NPS-wide Planning, Environment and Public Comment (PEPC) website, which provides information on current projects and serves as the place to review and comment on planning documents.     Volunteer!    For more information or questions on any of GGNRAâ€™s projects, contact us by e-mail or call (415) 561-4930.  Please send written correspondence to:  Golden Gate National Recreation Area c/o Division of Planning Fort Mason, Building 201 San Francisco, CA 94123
